description.value: A condition is pathological or non-pathological state that presents with symptoms. It is 'that what the patient has'. A health professional can assign a (differential) diagnosis to the condition. The symptoms as well as the diagnostic insight with respect to the same condition may change over time.

purpose.value: This Condition resource represents the Condition related concepts for implementations following the information standard [CiO](https://informatiestandaarden.nictiz.nl/wiki/Landingspagina_Contra-indicaties_en_Overgevoeligheden). This profile is largely based on the Dutch zib ('Zorginformatiebouwsteen', i.e. Health and Care Information Model) Condition that will be part of the 2024 prepublication, but also contains several concepts from the zibs HypersensitivityIntolerance and Reaction. Therefore it has no dependency on a corresponding nl-core profile and mappings to zib concepts are not defined. Instead mappings to the CiO data set have been added. It is the intention to derive this profile from a more general nl-core-Condition profile in the future.

comment.value: This profile is always used together with an instance conforming to either the [cio-HypersensitivityIntolerance](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/cio-HypersensitivityIntolerance) or [cio-Reaction](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/cio-Reaction) profile. These latter profiles contain more detailed information on the hypersensitivity intolerance reaction, while this Condition profile contains the underlying condition and diagnosis. Note however, that several concepts from the CiO data set are mapped to elements in both this profile and the cio-HypersensitivityIntolerance and cio-Reaction profiles, such as the Diagnostician or the RegistrationDateTime. This is done to populate all instances with as much relevant information as possible, hence making instances conforming to these three profiles more valuable to be considered in isolation. If such an overlapping element is present in one of the resources, it SHALL also be present in the other resource, having the same value. Moreover, both the AllergyIntolerance and Condition resources SHALL be linked via the same Provenance resource, as they functionally are considered as a single entity.

definition.value: Date (and time) at which the health professional obtained the diagnostic insight.

Globally unique number that identifies the instantiation of the information model. The number is composed of an identification of the issuer organization and a unique number assigned by this organization.
Indication of the severity of the condition. A condition may cause few or mild symptoms and yet be serious, but the reverse is also possible.
The term with associated code that the health professional selects from the used code list. Represents the hypersensitivity intolerances interpretation of the condition.

comment.value: Ideally, in the context of a HypersensitivityIntolerance or Reaction the DiagnosisName (cio-dataelement-20-796 and cio-dataelement-20-815, respectively) would be mapped on `AllergyIntolerance.code` (in the cio-HypersensitivityIntolerance and cio-Reaction profile, respectively) instead of including it in the Condition resource. However, the cardinality of `AllergyIntolerance.code` is `0..1`, and both Substance/CausativeSubstance (cio-dataelement-20-793/cio-dataelement-20-466) and DiagnosisName semantically map to that element in their respective profiles. Moreover these data elements describe the hypersensitivity intolerance reaction from different points of view, namely from the substance that triggers a reaction upon exposure or has triggered a reaction (Substance/CausativeSubstance), and the underlying diagnosis of the hypersensitivity intolerance reaction (DiagnosisName). Therefore they cannot be viewed as representations of the same concept with slightly different granularity and it is thus not allowed to include them both as different `AllergyIntolerance.code.coding`s. As Substance/CausativeSubstance contain more detailed information regarding the nature of the hypersensitivity intolerance/reaction, it has been chosen to map these directly to `AllergyIntolerance.code`, while DiagnosisName is mapped to `Condition.code` instead.

definition.value: A more detailed description of the name of the hypersensitivity intolerance reaction in free text, when this detail is not available in the used code list.
Date and time when the information was recorded in the patient's record.
The person who is responsible for entering the information in the patient's record.

The health professional that acquired the diagnostic insight regarding the hypersensitivity intolerance reaction. This can be a different individual than the person who recorded the diagnostic insight.
A comment in free text with respect to the condition, that is not represented by the other data elements in the information model.
